name: AkhR
gene_snapshot_text: Adipokinetic hormone receptor (AkhR) encodes a G protein-coupled receptor for the hormone encoded by Akh. It modulates both lipid and carbohydrate homeostasis.

Gene sequence location is 2L:6711286..6716186. Its molecular function is described by: neuropeptide receptor activity; peptide binding; G protein-coupled receptor activity; adipokinetic hormone receptor activity; adipokinetic hormone binding. It is involved in the biological process described with 9 unique terms, many of which group under: homeostatic process; chemical homeostasis; lipid homeostasis; cellular response to stimulus; acylglycerol homeostasis. No alleles are reported. Summary of modENCODE Temporal Expression Profile:  Temporal profile ranges from a peak of moderately high expression to a trough of extremely low expression.  Peak expression observed during late larval stages, during early pupal stages.

name: CCKLR-17D3

name: Hr4
gene_snapshot_text: Hormone receptor 4 (Hr4) encodes a nuclear receptor that acts both upstream and downstream of the steroid hormone ecdysone. In the prothoracic gland the product of Hr4 acts as a repressor of ecdysone production. In other tissues, including the salivary gland and the fat body, Hr4 is transcriptionally induced by ecdysone to transduce the effects of the hormone.

Gene sequence location is 3R:10737592..10751228. Its molecular function is described by: neuropeptide receptor activity; tachykinin receptor activity; G protein-coupled receptor activity. It is involved in the biological process described with: neuropeptide signaling pathway; tachykinin receptor signaling pathway; G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway; inter-male aggressive behavior. No alleles are reported. Summary of modENCODE Temporal Expression Profile:  Temporal profile ranges from a peak of low expression to a trough of extremely low expression.  Peak expression observed within 12-24 hour embryonic stages, during early larval stages, during late pupal stages, in adult male stages.

name: rk
gene_snapshot_text: rickets (rk) encodes a G-protein coupled receptor that signals intracellularly using the second messenger cAMP. It binds the heterodimeric hormone bursicon and is developmentally important for molting-related behaviors. It is also required after adult emergence for cuticle hardening and melanization.
summary: The gene rickets is referred to in FlyBase by the symbol Dmel\rk (CG8930, FBgn0003255). It is a protein_coding_gene from Dmel. Gene sequence location is 2L:13982743..14001248. It is involved in the biological process described with 8 unique terms, many of which group under: multicellular organismal process; multicellular organism reproduction; epithelial cell differentiation; biological regulation; cellular response to stimulus. No alleles are reported. Summary of modENCODE Temporal Expression Profile:  Temporal profile ranges from a peak of moderate expression to a trough of extremely low expression.  Peak expression observed at stages throughout the pupal period.

name: sNPF-R
gene_snapshot_text: short neuropeptide F receptor (sNPF-R) encodes the G-protein-coupled receptor for the  neuropeptide ligand encoded by sNPF, which utilizes the intracelluar ERK pathway or PKA-CREB pathway. It contributes to the regulation of growth, food intake, food-search behavior, appetitive memory, and sleep.
